title: The ‘Slow Burn’ That Is Henry Taylor
description: The artist’s survey at MOCA, with its empathetic portraits and quirky sculptures, speaks to the larger struggle of Black artists to achieve a level of recognition that is long overdue.
dc:creator: Robin Pogrebin
category: Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art
media:credit: Ricardo Nagaoka for The New York Times
media:description: Henry Taylor at his studio on Jefferson Boulevard in Los Angeles, dedicated to his sculptural practice. Objects found in flea markets, vintage stores or salvaged over 20 years form assemblages that mimic the way his paintings come together, sourced from images and moments in time.
